title: Protein digestibility and bioavailability of the F2 homozygous crossing line of the congenic mice for the lean locus Fob3b2, fed by high fat diet

author: Tatjana Pirman, Biotechnical Faculty, University of Ljubljana

segmentation: Now we're going back to the laboratory animals we were talking about the laboratory mice, but still we are staying in the field of nutrition.
Obesity we all know is a problem is a major problem of maternal SoC and we can see in the street everywhere that more and more people have problem with their body mass.
Andover City is also risk factor for developing the better cardiovascular disease, increased blood pressure, cancer and etc.

Additionally, fed the position in domestic animals is also undesirable component of growth in the term of consumers and also in the economy of production because of the slow growth and because of poor fit conversion.
Obesity is a complex trait and it is affected by worrying genetic, an interacting environmental factors.
Heritability is calculated between 50 and 75%, so we can say that have a strong genetic basis.

The aim of our study was to determine whether there are differences in protein digestibility and or biological bio availability of those proteins among F2 homozygotes from across of congenic lines with different genetic variation for the little locals hope to be free.
We have a.
House, which were originated from the University of Wedding Berg.

This originated line of Mouse had approximately 10% of fat and after 4050 three generation of selection we selected or at the University of any work selected fat Mouse and Lynn Mouse at the age of 14 weeks the percentage of fat in the fat Mouse was it what it is 23%.
And in the Lin mouse it is just 4%.
In our Institute in the Genetical Institute of our faculty was obtained M2 line by crossing Linnan Fat Mouse and after 10 back crossing the Discogenic line was obtained.
This means that almost all genotype was from the fat mouse, just small segment in the chromosome 15 was from the lean genotype.

After that this line was crossing with Fat Mouse and we obtained 25% of LL homozygote, 25% of FF homozygotes and 50% of heterozygotes for the purpose of this experiment it was using those two different homozygotes and for the control we use the Lean mouse.
If you go to the material and methods I loaded this say that we use the FF and LL mouse.
We have 11 more male and female animals in each group, so those two different than genotype San for the control views as already say, this lean mouse.
Also there were male and female mouse.
We have an experimental procedure when we mouse individually housed in metabolic cages.
Those metabolic cages unable the separately collection of urine and feces.
And we can also measure the diet intake.
You have seven days of pre experimental period.
At that time animals used to those cages to environmental and after that we have 5 days of experimental period.
At that time we collected the feces and urine and also we measure the diet.
Intake animals have free access to the water and to the diot and at that time we also recorded the.
Mass of animals and each day we changing the diet and weight the eaten Dyett each day at a pretty experimental period.
We have some problems because animals lose their weight becausw before animals were in the cages.

Without mass and when they come to the metabolic cages, they were individually housed and there were some problems, but not after those pre experimental peridot in those five days the mass of animals stay more or less the same.
As I already said we slept with collected physician during those five successive days and after that we determined the nitrogen in the diot interfaces and.
You didn't buy the cheddar method.
The diot we used for both homozygotes.
We use high fat diet and for the Lynemouth Usercontrol Dyett.
This was a normal diet which is used for the animals high fat diet.
We can see that the amount of wet was indeed Dyett almost 10 times higher is and in the normal in the control diet and also the protein content was higher.
We considered energy content.
It was calculated energy content was almost 30% higher in the high for dieters in the control, so direct competition between those homozygotes and the control animals cannot be done.
This control was just in case that we see if all the procedure goes goes on well.
As I learned.
Say that bodymass.
Through the experiment, Five days experiment was more or less the same in the.
Between from the beginning to the end of experiment and it was some high risk compared to the Lynemouth and diet intake was.
Approximately 3 gram per day.
But for the control for the control that was higher, but it is normal because the energy content in the control diet was smaller.
After that we also calculate the nitrogen.
At night, the nitrogen excreted through feces and urine, and also how much nitrogen was eaten by the diot.
We could see that there is no difference between those two homozygotes against.
They are different to the control, but they already said this is normal because there was a different dyett and there was a different animals.
We calculate the apparent digestibility, so how much nitrogen stay after they were digested through the digestive tract?
We calculated the apparent biological value.
This means how much nitrogen stays after it was.
Absorbed through the intestinal wall to the into the metabolism apps and also we calculate apparent net protein utilization.
This means the efficiency of using nitrogen for the animals.
As before, the values.
Also this show that protein digestability, biological value and net protein protein utilization work was more or less the same in those who music was group.
But again in the control those values were smaller.
I cannot say that this is statistical difference becauses there was a different Dyett and we cannot directly compare those.
Animals if.

We conclude we could say that fanatic phenotypic difference between the genotype in those in M2F2 population are not to differences in there just ability or need protein protein utilization becausw we saw that it was the same neverless we have LL or FF homozygotes.
And phenotypic differences are not caused by the differences in nutrient absorption between the genotype, because again, it was different biological value.
But we could say the differential effect of those dis locals is on the metabolic on the metabolism or on the energy expander.
So some animals probably use more energy because of that they have a different phenotypic look.
Thank you.
